articles.title: Jake Scott
articles.contents:
Jake Scott
          
          
          Home
          Projects
          CV
          â˜°
          
          
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Jake Scott
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                        LinkedIn
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        Twitter
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        GitHub
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        Email
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            Welcome to my personal website! I currently work as a Community
            Development Analyst at the Federal Reserve Bank of New
            York. Here, I combine original data analysis with insights
            gathered from interviews, roundtables, and working groups
            with experts and stakeholders to generate briefs, reports,
            and whitepapers. These span topics ranging from the
            electrification of affordable housing to the size
            and growth of the community development financial
            institution (CDFI) industry. I also conduct outreach and
            organize events that bring together policymakers, investors,
            advocates, and other stakeholders on topics such as
            affordable service-enriched senior housing and employee
            stock ownership plans.
            Prior to my current position, I worked as a senior
            research assistant for the Monetary
            Studies Section of the Federal Reserve Board, a research
            intern at the Hamilton Project at
            Brookings, as a data research intern at Burgiss, and as a data
            intern at the Colgate
            Data Collaboratory. I have also published academic
            research as a research assistant and coauthor, done work
            raising money as a student caller, knocked on doors as a
            political canvasser, and taught students as an economics
            tutor. The through line for all of this work, as well as my
            personal projects, is a deep interest in using data to
            understand and impact the world, particularly in the realm
            of public policy, urban planning, and the economy.
            I am a proud member of the Colgate University class of
            2020, where I studied economics and political science.
            Outside of work, I enjoy reading, watching the Giants,
            Mets, and Sixers, and exploring NYC. Please feel free to
            reach out if you have any questions about my work or if you
            just want to chat about R or anything else!
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Jake Scott

articles.title: My Projects
articles.contents:
White Papers,
Reports, and Briefs




Sustainable Affordable Housing: Strategies for Financing an Inclusive Energy Transition


Combined original data analysis with aggregated insights and recommendations from experts, stakeholders, and policymakers to assess the challenges and opportunities for electrifying multifamily properties in New York State.






Sizing the CDFI Market: Understanding Industry Growth


Combined multiple data sets and conducted original analysis to generate first-of-its-kind comprehensive estimate of the size and recent growth of the Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) industry.






Seeking Solutions for the Costs and Challenges of Food Insecurity


Combined original analysis of the Global Food Security Index (GSFI) from Economist Impact with insights from global experts to highlight challenges of and solutions for food insecurity.




Academic
Articles




Incentivizing STEM Participation: Evidence from the SMART Grant Program


Evaluated the effects of the SMART Grant program on college graduates' major fields and subsequent STEM workforce retention using nationally-representative survey data and a difference-in-differences quasi-experimental approach.






The Endogeneity of the Natural Rate of Growth in the United
States


Applied Okun's Equation and Thirlwall's Reversal Method to quarterly data on unemployment and gross domestic product in the United States to test the assumption that the natural rate of growth is exogenous to actual growth.






Measurement Sensitivity in Field-of-Study Mismatch Research


Applied simple linear regression and linear probability models on data from the National Survey of College Graduates to demonstrate that the predicted causes and consequences of field-of-study mismatch are highly sensitive to how one measures mismatch itself.






(Not) Working 9 to 5: Using Music Characteristic and Song Lyric
Data to Predict Initial Claims


Used lasso regression and machine learning to assess whether the features and sentiment of popular music in a given week could predict initial claims data.




Medium Articles




He Dies, She Sucks


Webscraped thousands of songs and their lyrics; used natural language processing to assess how different genders are sung about differently in popular music.






What's in a Word?


I use the discography of Run the Jewels to demonstrate the systematic drawbacks of tf-idf as a measure of term importance, and propose and defend an alternative measure.




Shiny Apps




Coronavirus Tracker Shiny App


Shiny web app that allows users to see Covid-19 cases and deaths at the national, state, and county level.






Prototype Spotify Analysis Application


Shiny web app that allows user to input their Spotify username and analyze the characteristics of their music.






Live 2020 Election Night Model


Shiny web app that fed real-time election data into the Economist Election Model and presented the resulting live win probabilities by state.
